training_organizations.name: Michigan DHHS Child Welfare Training Institute (CWTI)
training_organizations.description: Michigan’s Department of Health & Human Services operates the Child Welfare Training Institute to prepare and develop its CPS workforce. New child protective services and foster care workers undergo an initial training program through CWTI that covers Michigan’s policies, MiSACWIS/CCWIS system usage, and field training. CWTI also offers in-service training and a supervisory training program to continually enhance practice.

training_organizations.name: Samaritas (formerly Lutheran Social Services of Michigan)
training_organizations.description: A large nonprofit agency in Michigan that contracts with MDHHS to handle foster care placements and adoption services. Samaritas oversees many foster homes and provides case management for children in foster care, working to reunify families or arrange adoptions. As a partner to the state, Samaritas also offers support services like foster parent training and resources for youth who age out of care.

training_organizations.name: Michigan CASA
training_organizations.description: A statewide association that supports local CASA programs in Michigan. Michigan CASA provides standards, training, and assistance to programs that train volunteer Court Appointed Special Advocates. These CASA volunteers are appointed by judges in some counties to advocate for abused/neglected children. By coordinating these efforts, Michigan CASA helps ensure that children in foster care have a consistent advocate in court focusing on their best interests.

perpetrator_relationships.relationship: Victim Was Child of Boyfriend or Girlfriend

refugee_assistance.recipient_name: MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF LABOR AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY

policies.TribalFoster: Yes, Tribes within state provide foster care
policies.ReportAnonymous: General public (not mandated reporters) can remain anonymous
policies.FatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.Def_Subtype_Abuse: Physical abuse includes drug or alcohol exposed infants
policies.Def_Subtype_Neglect: Neglect includes physical neglect, failure to protect, improper supervision, abandonment, and inadequate food, clothing, shelter, and medical care.
policies.EquityStaff_Specify: Michigan Department of Health and Human Services (MDHHS) diversity committee
policies.DefPerp_OtherSpecify: Member of the clergy; Individual 18 years of age or older who is involved with a youth program
policies.TribalFoster_Specify: Sault Ste. Marie Tribe of Chippewa Indians, Grand Traverse Band of Ottawa and Chippewa Indians, Keweenaw Bay Indian Community, Little Traverse Bay Bands of Odawa Indians, Bay Mills Indian Community, Hannahville Potawatomi Indian Community, Saginaw Chippewa Indian Tribe of Michigan, Lac Vieux Desert Band of Lake Superior Chippewa Indians
policies.ConsentDecree_Specify: Dwayne B. vs. Snyder; Dwayne B. vs. Granholm
policies.Reporter_OtherSpecify: Any employee of an organization or entity that, as a result of federal funding statutes, regulations, or contracts, would be prohibited from reporting in the absence of a state mandate or court order
policies.InvestReq_OtherSpecify: Document information on history/trends on case members; Visually assess alleged injuries
policies.ScreenReq_OtherSpecify: Determination of priority response of the case using a minimal priority response criteria
policies.ScreenInfo_OtherSpecify: Four elements must be present in order to assign a complaint for investigation: (1) Allegations of harm or threatened harm (2) to a child's health or welfare (3) through non-accidental or neglectful behavior (4) by a person responsible for the child's health and welfare
policies.EquityStaff_OtherSpecify: The DEI Council aims to identify and eliminate systemic bias in department's policies and procedures. DEI initiatives are incorporated in the following areas: leadership support; culture and climate; recruiting, hiring and retention; training and professional development; and service delivery. Each department is charged with addressing DEI issues in their respective units. Employees attend mandatory trainings on implicit bias and racial disproportionality.
policies.InvestQual_TrainingSpecify: Michigan Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information System (MiSACWIS) Security computer-based training (CBT) and pass the associated exam with a score of 90 percent or higher prior to accessing MiSACWIS; Complete the Pre-Service Institute (PSI) within 112 days of hire if not previously completed
policies.InvestQual_ExperienceSpecify: Supervisors must have either: (1) 3 years of experience in a child welfare agency, a child caring institution, or in an agency performing a child welfare function with a master's degree (2) 4 years of experience in a child welfare agency, a child caring institution, or in an agency performing a child welfare function with a bachelor's degree
policies.InvestReq_OtherCases_Specify: Documenting history/trends required for all; Visually assessing injuries required when allegations include injury on the child's body; however, if injuries to buttocks or genitalia for children older than age 6, medical examination is required
policies.ReporterPenalty_OtherSpecify: Any employee of an organization or entity that, as a result of federal funding statutes, regulations, or contracts, would be prohibited from reporting in the absence of a state mandate or court order
policies.ScreenerQual_TrainingSpecify: Michigan Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information System (MiSACWIS) Security computer-based training (CBT) and pass the associated exam with a score of 90 percent or higher prior to accessing MiSACWIS; Centralized intake (CI) specialists who have not previously completed a pre-service institute (PSI) must complete PSI for Child Protection Services (CPS); CI specialists who have previously completed PSI but have not worked in CPS must attend centralized intake program-specific transfer training with the Office of Workforce Development Training and CI Local Office Experts (LOEs); CI specialists with prior CPS experience must attend training with CI LOEs; CI supervisors must attend New Supervisor Institute training for CPS within 112 days of hire/promotion if not previously completed; All will receive on-the job training from CI LOEs
policies.AntiDiscrim_Staff_VarySpecify: (1) Age, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, national origin, marital status, genetic information, partisan consideration, height, and weight are specified for staff from child welfare agency and contracted child welfare provider organizations; (2) Religion is specified for staff from child welfare agency, contracted child welfare provider organizations, foster parents, and kinship caregivers
policies.FatalitiesDefine_OtherSpecify: Sudden or unexpected death of an infant or child
policies.CaseManagerQual_ExperienceSpec: Supervisors must have either: (1) 3 years of experience in a child welfare agency, a child caring institution, or in an agency performing a child welfare function with a master's degree or (2) 4 years of experience in a child welfare agency, a child caring institution, or in an agency performing a child welfare function with a bachelor's degree
policies.InvestReq_MedEvalCases_Specify: Physical abuse; Sexual abuse; Allegations or indication that the child has been seriously or repeatedly physically injured as a result of abuse and/or neglect; The extent of the alleged abuse could cause unseen injuries (such as internal injuries or brain injuries); There is indication that the child suffers from malnourishment; There is indication that the child may need medical treatment; The child has been exposed to or had contact with methamphetamine production; An infant who is not mobile and has marks or bruises; The child has an injury and the parent, child or caretaker has provided an explanation of the injury that is not credible or is suspicious; The child has unusual bruises, marks or signs of extensive or chronic physical injury; The child has an injury and also appears to be fearful of parent(s)/caregiver(s) or exhibits characteristics such as anxiousness or being withdrawn; The child has an injury alleged or suspected to be from abuse and the parent/caregiver/alleged perpetrator has previously been found to be a perpetrator of severe physical injury
policies.ScreenerQual_ExperienceSpecify: Supervisors must have either: (1) 3 years of experience in a child welfare agency, a child caring institution, or in an agency performing a child welfare function with a master's degree or (2) 4 years of experience in a child welfare agency, a child caring institution, or in an agency performing a child welfare function with a bachelor's degree.
policies.CaseManagerQual_TrainingSpecify: Michigan Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information System (MiSACWIS) Security computer-based training (CBT) and pass the associated exam with a score of 90 percent or higher prior to accessing MiSACWIS; Foster care caseworkers must complete the Pre-Service Institute (PSI) within 112 days of hire, if not previously completed
policies.InvestReq_PerpCrimCases_Specify: Physical abuse; Sexual abuse; Human trafficking cases
policies.ExtFosterCare_Criteria_OtherSpec: Volunteering for a community organization for at least 80 hours per month, or in combination with education or employment to meet minimum eligibility requirements
policies.InvestReq_HomeStudyCases_Specify: If the allegations are about the conditions of the home
policies.InvestReq_PerpPriorCPSCases_Spec: When there is a history/trend of child abuse
